Description: Worn painted pottery shabti of Djedkhons(?), a Wʿb-priest of Amun(?), with a lappet-wig tied with a black fillet, a modelled face and joined hands in relief holding two black hoes; the front of the remaining leg section is inscribed with black painted Hieroglyphs(worn); the flat back is decorated with a representation of a black seed-basket; the lower leg section has broken away.
Condition: incomplete - lower leg section missing, paint worn
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore (?)
